alert.note: Alert for White (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 10:12PM EDT until March 31 at 10:45PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN WHITE AND SOUTHEASTERN PULASKI COUNTIES... At 1011 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Francesville, or 11 miles southwest of Winamac, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Winamac. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN <50 MPH
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Heavy rainfall may hide this tornado. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
